Sentencas: Reversible solid oxide cells based on proton conductors (P-ReSOCs) have potential to be the most efficient and low-cost option for large-scale energy storage and power generation, holding promise as an enabler for the implementation of intermittent renewable energy technologies and the widespread utilization of hydrogen.
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Here, the rational design of a new class of hexavalent Mo/W-doped proton-conducting electrolytes with excellent durability while maintaining high conductivity is reported.
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: Specifically, BaMo(W)(0.03)Ce0.71Yb0.26O3-delta exhibits dramatically enhanced chemical stability against high concentrations of steam and carbon dioxide than the state-of-the-art electrolyte materials while retaining similar ionic conductivity.
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: In addition, P-ReSOCs based on BaW0.03Ce0.71Yb0.26O3-delta demonstrate high peak power densities of 1.54, 1.03, 0.72, and 0.48 W cm(-2) at 650, 600, 550, and 500 degrees C, respectively, in the fuel cell mode.
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: During steam electrolysis, a high current density of 2.28 A cm(-2) is achieved at a cell voltage of 1.3 V at 600 degrees C, and the electrolysis cell can operate stably with no noticeable degradation when exposed to high humidity of 30% H2O at -0.5
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells

Sentencas: A cm(-2) and 600 degrees C for over 300 h. Overall, this work demonstrates the promise of donor doping for obtaining proton conductors with both high conductivity and chemical stability for P-ReSOCs.
Titulo: A New Class of Proton Conductors with Dramatically Enhanced Stability and High Conductivity for Reversible Solid Oxide Cells
